children.name: rowspan
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Number of rows this cell is to occupy.

Default: 0

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 1);
children.text2: The following shows how to create a Cell object spanning a single row and single column.

children.name: colspan
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Number of columns this cell is to occupy.

Default: 0

children.name: Cell(Number rowspan, Number colspan)
children.text: Instantiates a new Cell object. Creates a cell which takes a custom amount of cell spaces in the table.
children.text2: Note: If you provide a negative number for either parameter, the value sets to 1.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 1); var image = new Image("<attachment_sys_id>"); cell.addImage(image);
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate an existing image attachment and add it to a cell in a table. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: image
children.text: Image
children.text2: Image to add to a table cell.

children.name: addImage(Image image)
children.text: Adds an image to a table cell.

children.name: paragraph
children.text: Paragraph
children.text2: Text to add to a table cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var para = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text."); cell.addParagraph(para);
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate paragraph objects and add the content cells in a table. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addParagraph(Paragraph paragraph)
children.text: Adds text to a table cell.

children.name: style
children.text: Style
children.text2: Style to apply to this element.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var style = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Style(); style.setBold(); cell.addStyle(style);
children.text2: The following shows how to apply a style to a table cell. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addStyle(Style style)
children.text: Applies a predefined style to table cells.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 1); var columnWidths = [100, 50, 50]; var table = new Table(columnWidths, false); cell.addTable(table);
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a table object and add it to a cell. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: table
children.text: Table
children.text2: Table to add to a cell.

children.name: addTable(Table table)
children.text: Adds a table to a cell.

children.name: Output
children.text: The column position for cell is 1

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 1); var columnWidths = [100, 50, 50]; var table = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Table(true, columnWidths, false); table.addCell(cell); var colNum = cell.getColumn(); gs.info("The column position for cell is " + colNum);
children.text2: The following  shows how to get the number of a column position for a cell.

children.name: Number
children.text: Number of the column position for a cell.

children.name: getColumn()
children.text: Gets the number of the column in which the cell is located.

children.name: Output
children.text: The row position for cell is 4927

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 1); var rowWidths = [100, 50, 50]; var table = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Table(true, rowWidths, false); table.addCell(cell); var rowNum = cell.getRow(); gs.info("The row position for cell is " + rowNum);
children.text2: The following  shows how to get the number of a row position for a cell.

children.name: Number
children.text: Number of the row position for a cell.

children.name: getRow()
children.text: Gets the number of rows in which the cell is located.

children.name: color
children.text: Color
children.text2: Background color.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var color = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([1, 0.9, 0.9]); // provided as array of RGB float values cell.setBackGroundColor(color);
children.text2: The following shows how to set cell background color. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setBackGroundColor(Color color)
children.text: Specifies a background color for the cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var width = 1.0; cell.setBorder(width);
children.text2: The following shows how to set a cell border of one point to all four edges of a cell. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.name: setBorder(Number width)
children.text: Sets a border for all four edges of a cell.

children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.name: Example

children.text: Sets a border for the lower limit of a cell.

children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var width = 1.0; cell.setLeftBorder(width);

children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.name: setBorderLeft(Number width)
children.text: Sets a border for the left limit of a cell.

children.text: Number

children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var width = 1.0; cell.setRightBorder(width);

children.name: setBorderRight(Number width)

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var width = 1.0; cell.setBorderTop(width);

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.name: setBorderTop(Number width)
children.text: Sets a border for the upper limit of a cell.

children.name: color
children.text: Color
children.text2: Cell border color.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var borderColor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.8,0.8,0.8]); var width = 1.0; cell.setColoredBorder(borderColor, width);
children.text2: The following shows how to set a colored cell border. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var borderColor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.8,0.8,0.8]); var width = 1.0; cell.setColoredBorderBottom(borderColor, width);
children.text2: The following shows how to set a colored lower cell border. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.text: Number
children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.text: Sets a colored border for the left limit of a cell.

children.name: Example

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var borderColor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.8,0.8,0.8]); var width = 1.0; cell.setColoredBorderTop(borderColor, width);
children.text2: The following shows how to set a colored top cell border. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2: Cell border width in points.

children.name: setColoredBorderTop(Color color, Number width)
children.text: Sets a colored border for the upper limit of a cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var height = 10; cell.setHeight(height);
children.text2: The following shows how set a cell height of 10 points. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: value
children.text: Number
children.text2: Cell height in points.

children.name: setHeight(Number height)
children.text: Sets the height of a cell.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Horizontal alignment setting.
Valid values:
  • center: Align contents to the center.
  • left: Align contents to the left.
  • right: Align contents to the right.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var alignment = "center"; cell.setHorizontalAlignment(alignment);
children.text2: The following shows how to set horizontal alignment on a cell. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setHorizontalAlignment(String alignment)
children.text: Sets the horizontal alignment for this cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var height = 409; cell.setMaxHeight(height);
children.text2: The following shows how set a maximum cell height of 409 points. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: value
children.text: Number
children.text2: Maximum cell height in points.

children.name: setMaxHeight(Number value)
children.text: Sets the maximum height of a cell.

children.name: value
children.text: Number
children.text2: Maximum cell width in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var width = 1530; cell.setMaxWidth(width);
children.text2: The following shows how set a maximum cell width of 1530 points. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setMaxWidth(float value)
children.text: Sets the maximum width of a cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var height = 12.75; cell.setMinHeight(height);
children.text2: The following shows how set a minimum cell height of 12.75 points. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: value
children.text: Number
children.text2: Minimum cell height in points.

children.name: setMinHeight(Number value)
children.text: Sets the minimum height of a cell.

children.name: value
children.text: Number
children.text2: Minimum cell width in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var width = 50.58; cell.setMinWidth(width);
children.text2: The following shows how set a minimum cell width of 50.58 points. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setMinWidth(Number value)
children.text: Sets the minimum width of a cell.

children.name: opacity
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Float decimal value from 0 through 1, in which 0 is transparent and 1 is fully opaque.

Default: 0

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var opacity = 0.5; cell.setOpacity(opacity);
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the opacity of a cell.

children.name: setOpacity(Number opacity)
children.text: Sets the opacity of cell content, borders, and background.
children.text2: Note: This setting affects all child elements of the cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var padding = 1.0; cell.setPadding(padding);
children.text2: The following shows how to set the bottom cell to one point. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: padding
children.text: Number
children.text2: Padding width in points as a decimal value.

children.name: setPadding(Number padding)
children.text: Sets the padding of all four sides of a cell to the same width.
children.text2:
See also:

  • setPaddingBottom()
  • setPaddingLeft()
  • setPaddingRight()
  • setPaddingTop()

children.name: padding
children.text: Number
children.text2: Padding width in points as a decimal value.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var padding = 1.0; cell.setPaddingBottom(padding);
children.text2: The following shows how to set bottom cell padding to one point. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setPaddingBottom(Number padding)
children.text: Sets the value of the bottom padding width of a cell.
children.text2:
See also:

  • setPadding()

  • setPaddingRight()
  • setPaddingTop()

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var padding = 1.0; cell.setPaddingLeft(padding);
children.text2: The following shows how to set left cell padding to one point. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: padding
children.text: Number

children.name: setPaddingLeft(Number padding)
children.text: Sets the value of the left padding width of a cell.
children.text2:
See also:

  • setPadding()
  • setPaddingBottom()
  • setPaddingRight()
  • setPaddingTop()

children.name: padding
children.text: Number
children.text2: Padding width in points as a decimal value.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var padding = 1.0; cell.setPaddingRight(padding);
children.text2: The following shows how to set right cell padding to one point. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setPaddingRight(Number padding)

children.text2:
See also:

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var padding = 1.0; cell.setPaddingTop(padding);
children.text2: The following shows how to set top cell padding to one point. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: padding
children.text: Number
children.text2: Padding width in points as a decimal value.

children.name: setPaddingTop(Number padding)
children.text: Sets the value of the top padding width of a cell.
children.text2:
See also:

  • setPadding()
  • setPaddingBottom()
  • setPaddingLeft()

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var alignment = "text-left"; cell.setTextAlignment(alignment);
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the cell text to left alignment.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Text alignment position.
Valid values:
  • text-center: Aligns text to the center.
  • text-justified: Modifies the space between characters to completely fill text between the left and right sides. The final line is left-aligned.
  • text-justified-all: Justifies text alignment including the final line.
  • text-left: Align text to the left.
  • text-right: Align text to the right.

children.name: setTextAlignment(String alignment)
children.text: Sets the text alignment of this cell.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 3); var alignment = "mid"; cell.setVerticalAlignment(alignment);
children.text2: The following shows how to set vertical alignment on a cell. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Vertical alignment setting.
Valid values:
  • bottom: Aligns contents to the bottom.
  • mid: Aligns contents to the center.
  • top: Aligns contents to the top.

children.name: setVerticalAlignment(String alignment)
children.text: Sets the vertical alignment for this cell.

name: Cell
text: Creates a Cell object as a cell in a table. You can use this API to format the cell and include additional blocks, such as paragraphs and images.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

This API is a component used with the Document API to generate a PDF.

children.name: colors
children.text: Array
children.text2: Three numbers indicating RGB values using a decimal value from 0 through 1. For example, in [0.1, 0.9, 0.5], the value of the first position is red, second is green, and third is blue. Also, [0, 0, 0] is solid black, [0.5, 0.5, 0.5] is solid gray, and [1, 1, 1] is solid white.

children.name: Example
children.text: var color = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.1, 0.9, 0.5]); //given as object containing RGB values
children.text2: The following shows how to create a Color object.

children.name: Color(Array colors)
children.text: Instantiates a new Color object with RGB values.
children.text2: Color can be applied to the following scenarios:

children.name: Example
children.text: var color1 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([1,0.5,0.5]); // given as an array of RGB values var color2 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.8,0.5,0.5]); // given as an array of RGB values var isequal = color1.equals(color2);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to create two color objects and determine if the colors
        match.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the values of two color objects match.

Valid values:
  • true: The colors match.
  • false: The colors do not match.

children.name: color
children.text: Color
children.text2: Color object to check for a match.

children.name: equals(Color color)
children.text: Indicates whether the values of two different color objects match.

children.name: Object
children.text: Color object reflecting the provided grayscale value.

children.name: grayScale
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Decimal value in the range 0 through 1, in which 0 is black and 1 is
                white.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grayColor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color.getGrayColor(0.5);
children.text2: The following  shows how to create a color object that is 50% grayscale.

children.name: getGrayColor(Number grayScale)
children.text: Returns a black, gray, or white color object.

children.name: colors
children.text: Array
children.text2: Three numbers indicating RGB values using a decimal value from 0 through 1. For example, in [0.1, 0.9, 0.5], the value of the first position is red, second is green, and third is blue. Also, [0, 0, 0] is solid black, [0.5, 0.5, 0.5] is solid gray, and [1, 1, 1] is solid white.

children.name: Example
children.text: var color = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([1,0.5,0.5]); //given as array of RGB values; color.setColorValue(color);
children.text2: The following  shows how to change the values of an existing color.

children.name: setColorValue(Array colors)
children.text:
Creates color with given values and enables you to change the values of an existing
    color. Each of the values must be from 0 through 1.

children.name: Example
children.text: var color = new Color([1,0.5,0.5]); color.setOpacity(0.5);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to create a color object and set its opacity to 50
        percent.

children.name: color
children.text: Color
children.text2:
Floating decimal value from 0 through 1, in which 0 is fully transparent and 1
                is fully opaque.

children.name: setOpacity(Number opacity)
children.text: Sets the level of color opacity.

name: Color
text: Creates a Color object used to define color attributes that you can apply to elements in a PDF; such as cells, tables, and lines.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

This API is a component used with the Document API to generate a PDF.

children.name: Object
children.text: PDF document.

children.name: pageSize
children.text: PdfPage
children.text2: PDF page size.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document(pageSize);
children.text2: The following shows how to create a Document object and return a PDF.

children.name: Document(PdfPage pageSize)
children.text: Instantiates a Document object and generates a PDF document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var para1 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This text lands on the first page."); var para2 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This text lands on the new page."); document.addParagraph(para1); document.addAndStartNewPage(); document.addParagraph(para2); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "newPage.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to add a new page to a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addAndStartNewPage()
children.text: Adds a page to the document by terminating the current page and creating a new one.
children.text2:
Additional methods for adding a new page in a document:

  • addNewPage() – Adds a new blank page to the document. Use to force a page break to start a new chapter or section in your document.
  • addNewPageAtIndex() – Adds a new page at the specified index of the document. For example, setting the index to 6 inserts a page six or inserts the page at the position of the existing page six in a document. The original page six becomes page seven.

children.name: author
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the document's author.

children.name: Example
children.text: var author = "John Do"; document.addAuthor(author);
children.text2: The following shows how to add a name to the author field in PDF document properties. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addAuthor(String author)
children.text: Adds a name to the author field in PDF document properties.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // declare image using sys attachment var image = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<imgAttachment_sys_id>"); // add the image to the doc document.addImage(image); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docWithImage.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to add an image to a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: image
children.text: Image
children.text2: Image to add to a document.

children.name: addImage(Image image)
children.text: Adds an image to a document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); document.addNewLine();
children.text2: The following shows how to add a new line to a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addNewLine()
children.text: Adds a new empty line to the document.

children.name: Example
children.text: Usage: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); document.addNewPage();
children.text2: The following shows how to add a new blank page to a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addNewPage()
children.text: Adds a new blank page to the document. Use to force a page break to start a new chapter or section in your document.
children.text2:
Additional methods for adding a new page in a document:

  • addAndStartNewPage()– Adds a page to the document by terminating the current page and creating a new one.
  • addNewPageAtIndex() – Adds a new page at the specified index of the document. For example, setting the index to 6 inserts a page six or inserts the page at the position of the existing page six in a document. The original page six becomes page seven.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var index = 6; document.addNewPageAtIndex(index);
children.text2: The following shows how to add a new PDF page to position 6 of a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: index
children.text: Number
children.text2: Position at which to insert a new page.

children.name: addNewPageAtIndex(Number index)
children.text: Adds a new page at the specified index of the document. For example, setting the index to 6 inserts a page six or inserts the page at the position of the existing page six in a document. The original page six becomes page seven.
children.text2:
Additional methods for adding a new page in a document:

  • addAndStartNewPage()– Adds a page to the document by terminating the current page and creating a new one.
  • addNewPage() – Adds a new blank page to the document. Use to force a page break to start a new chapter or section in your document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var para = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet."; document.addParagraph(para);
children.text2: The following shows how to add a paragraph to a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: paragraph
children.text: Paragraph
children.text2: Block of text provided as a paragraph object.

children.name: addParagraph(Paragraph paragraph)
children.text: Adds a paragraph to a document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var table = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Table([70,200], false); document.addTable(table);
children.text2: The following shows how to add a table to a document. See the Table API for more details on how to define a table. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: table
children.text: Table
children.text2: Table to be inserted into the document.

children.name: addTable(Table table)
children.text: Adds a table to a document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); document.close();
children.text2: The following shows how to close a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: close()
children.text: Closes a document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize);
children.text2: The following shows how to create a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: Object
children.text: PDF document.

children.name: pageSize
children.text: PdfPage
children.text2: Document page size.

children.name: createDocument(PdfPage pageSize)
children.text: Creates a document with the specified page size.

children.name: Number
children.text: Number of pages in the document.

children.name: Output
children.text: The number of pages is 9

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var count = document.getPageCount(); gs.info("The number of pages is " + count);
children.text2: The following shows how to get the page count of a nine-page document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: getPageCount()
children.text: Gets the number of pages in the document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var pagesize = document.getPageSize();
children.text2: The following shows how to get the page size of a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: String
children.text:
Value of the default page size set using the PdfPage API.
Possible values:
  • A4 – 595 x 842 points
  • EXECUTIVE – 522 x 756 points
  • LETTER – 612 x 792 points
  • LEDGER – 792 x 1224 points

children.name: getPageSize()
children.text: Gets the default page size of the document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var closed = document.isClosed();
children.text2: The following shows how to get the page size of a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: None
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether a document is open or closed.
Valid values:
  • true: Document is closed.
  • false: Document is open.

Default: true

children.name: isClosed()
children.text: Indicates whether a document is closed or open.

children.name: Example
children.text: var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // Additional document properties document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "SampleDocGeneration.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to attach a document to an incident record. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: tableName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the table on which to attach the document.

children.name: String
children.text:
Sys_id of the attached document in the Attachments [sys_attachment]
                table.

children.name: tableSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the record on which to attach the document.

children.name: fileName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the document to attach.

children.name: saveAsAttachment(String tableName, String tableSysId, String fileName)
children.text: Attaches the document file to the specified target table.

children.name: direction
children.text: String
children.text2:
Text flow direction.
Valid values:
  • LEFT_TO_RIGHT: Order text flow left to right. The text direction is only reordered if left-to-right language characters are detected.
  • RIGHT_TO_LEFT: Order text flow right to left. The text direction is only reordered if right-to-left language characters are detected.

Default: LEFT_TO_RIGHT

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); document.setBaseDirection("RIGHT_TO_LEFT");
children.text2: The following shows how to set text flow left to right. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setBaseDirection(String direction)
children.text:
Sets the base text flow direction to reorder from based on character
    recognition

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); document.setMargins(72,36,36,36);
children.text2: The following shows how to set page margins in a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: topMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Height of the top margin in points.

children.name: rightMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the right margin in points.

children.name: bottomMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Height of the bottom margin in points.

children.name: leftMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the left margin in points.

children.name: setMargins(Number topMargin, Number rightMargin, Number bottomMargin, Number leftMargin)
children.text: Sets the page margin sizes in the document.

name: Document
text:
The Document API provides methods to initialize a PDF, add content,  and close the PDF.
    After adding content, the document can be attached to a target record.

children.name: attachmentSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of an image in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var image = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<sys_id>");
children.text2: The following shows how to create a Image object.

children.name: Image(String attachmentSysId)
children.text: Instantiates a new Image object. Used to verify if an image attachment exists and is available for modification.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2: Image width in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var scaleAbsPic = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<img_sys_id>"); scaleAbsPic.scaleAbsolute(25,50); document.addImage(scaleAbsPic); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docWithImg.pdf");
children.text2:
The following  shows how to add an image to a PDF with absolute width and height
        settings.

children.name: height
children.text: Number
children.text2: Image height in points.

children.name: scaleAbsolute(Number width, Number height)
children.text:
Scales an image to absolute width and height sizes. This setting does not preserve the
    width-height ratio of the image and might result in undesired stretching if settings are not
    precise.
children.text2: To scale to an absolute size that preserves width-height ratio of an image, use the scaleToFit() method.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2: Maximum image width in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // add a table var table = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Table([1,3],false); // text for the left column var text = "sample image"; // add a table cell for the image in the right column var imgCell = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Cell(1, 1); // add an image and set it scale-to-fit var scaleToFitPic = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<img_sys_id>"); scaleToFitPic.scaleToFit(90,175); // add the image to the cell imgCell.addImage(scaleToFitPic); table.addTextCell(text); table.addCell(imgCell); // Here's a paragraph var para = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("The following table image uses scale to fit."); document.addParagraph(para); document.addTable(table); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "imgScaleToFit.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to insert an image scaled to fit using the Cell – addImage() method.

children.name: height
children.text: Number
children.text2: Maximum image height in points.

children.name: scaleToFit(Number width, Number height)
children.text:
Scales an image to an absolute size while preserving the width-height
    ratio.
children.text2: Resulting output varies by image aspect ratio. If the width and height parameter values do not match the image aspect ratio, one value renders smaller in output than the value given.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // Add a table var table = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Table([1,2],false); // Text in left column var text = "sample image"; // Image in right column var autoScaledPic = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<image_sys_id>"); autoScaledPic.setAutoScale(true); table.addTextCell(text); table.addImageCell(autoScaledPic); document.addTable(table); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "imgAutoScale.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to add an image to a PDF with automatic scaling. The image is added using the Table – addImageCell() method.

children.name: value
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to automatically scale an image.

Valid values:
  • true: Automatically scales the image
  • false: Image does not scale

Default: false

children.name: setAutoScale(Boolean value)
children.text:
Enables scaling width and height to a page or cell while retaining
    dimensions.

children.name: color
children.text: Color
children.text2: Image border color.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var borderColor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([1.0,0.0,0.0]); // declare image using sys attachment var image = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<imgAttachment_sys_id>"); image.setColoredBorder(borderColor, 5); document.addImage(image); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docWithBorderedImage.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to set a five-point red-colored border on an image.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the border in points.

children.name: setColoredBorder(Color color, Number width)
children.text: Sets a border on a PDF in the specified color.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Positions image alignment on a page or block element.
Valid values:
  • Center
  • Left
  • Right

Default: Left

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // declare image using sys attachment var image = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<imgAttachment_sys_id>"); String alignment = "Center"; image.setHorizontalAlignment(alignment); document.addImage(image); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<sys_id>", "docWithImageCentered.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to add a centered image on a PDF page.

children.name: setHorizontalAlignment(String alignment)
children.text: Sets the horizontal alignment of the image.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // declare image using sys attachment var image = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Image("<imgAttachment_sys_id>"); image.setNoBorder(); document.addImage(image); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<sys_id>", "docWithImgNoBorder.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to add an image to a document without a border.

children.name: setNoBorder()
children.text: Sets an image to have no border.

name: Image
text: Creates an Image object representing an image and its layout insert in a PDF. Enables defining attributes such as scale, alignment, and border color.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

This API is a component used with the Document API to generate a PDF.

You can add an image to a PDF using one of the following methods:
  • Cell – addImage(Image image) – Adds an image to a table cell
  • Table – addImageCell(Image image) – Adds a cell that contains an image to a table.
  • Document – addImage(Image image) - Adds an image to a page

children.name: Example
children.text: var line = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Line();
children.text2: The following s shows how to create a Line object.

children.name: Line()
children.text: Instantiates a new Line object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var num = 1; var xpos = 100; var ypos = 100; var width = 450; var linewidth = 2.5; document.addNewPage(); var line = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Line(); line.drawLine(document, num, xpos, ypos, width, linewidth); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<sys_id>", "line.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to create a line at the lower margin of a document page. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: Document
children.text: Document
children.text2: Name of the document object.

children.name: pageNo
children.text: Number
children.text2: Page number on which you want to place the line.

children.name: xPos
children.text: Number
children.text2: X-coordinate area of the page on which to place the line.

children.name: yPos
children.text: Number
children.text2: Y-coordinate area of the page on which to place the line.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Width area of the page in which you want to draw the line. Values are in
                points.

children.name: lineWidth
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Optional. Value of line thickness in points.

Default: 1

children.name: drawLine(Document document, Number pageNo, Number xPos, Number yPos, Number width, Number lineWidth)
children.text: Places a line on a document page.

children.name: color
children.text: Color
children.text2: Line color.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var num = 1; var xpos = 100; var ypos = 100; var width = 450; var linewidth = 2.5; var color = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.5,0.5,0.8]); //given as array of RGB values; document.addNewPage(); var line = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Line(); line.setColor(color); line.drawLine(document, num, xpos, ypos, width, linewidth); document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<sys_id>", "lineWithColor.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to create a line and set its color in a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: setColor(Color color)
children.text: Sets the color of a line.

name: Line
text: Creates a Line object using methods to draw a line in a PDF.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

This API is a component used with the Document API to generate a PDF.

children.name: text
children.text: String
children.text2: Paragraph block of text.

children.name: Example
children.text: var para = new Paragraph("hello");
children.text2: The following shows how to create a Paragraph object. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: Paragraph(String text)
children.text: Instantiates a new Paragraph object containing a string.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var myPara = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This is a paragraph."); myPara.addNewLine(); document.addParagraph(myPara); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "addText.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to add a new line after a paragraph in a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addNewLine()
children.text: Adds an empty line after a paragraph in a document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var sectionPara = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This is the first paragraph."); var subPara1 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Pellentesque nec neque interdum turpis ultricies tristique at ut lacus. Nam eget sollicitudin."); var subPara2 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla vel ultrices erat."); var subPara3 = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Aenean fermentum lorem congue metus faucibus, vitae viverra quam eleifend. Donec sed risus quis eros suscipit efficitur."); sectionPara.addParagraph(subPara1); sectionPara.addParagraph(subPara2); sectionPara.addParagraph(subPara3); document.addParagraph(sectionPara); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "filename.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to add a section of paragraphs to a document. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: paragraph
children.text: Paragraph
children.text2: Paragraph object.

children.name: addParagraph(Paragraph paragraph)
children.text:
Adds a paragraph. You can use this method to create a block of paragraphs with
    automatic line breaks.

children.name: content
children.text: String
children.text2: Information to include in a paragraph.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var myPara = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This is the first sentence."); myPara.addString(" This is the second sentence in the same paragraph. Spaces are not inserted automatically.") document.addParagraph(myPara); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "filename.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to add a new sentence to a paragraph. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: addString(String content)
children.text:
Adds a string of text to a paragraph. This method does not automatically insert a space
    preceding the content.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // Create a font color (result is purple) var fontColor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Color([0.5,0.0,0.5]); // Create a style for your paragraph var paraStyle = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Style(); paraStyle.setFontColor(fontColor); paraStyle.setFontSize(10); var myPara = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This paragraph has style."); myPara.addStyle(paraStyle); document.addParagraph(myPara); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "addStyle.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to apply a style to a paragraph. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: style
children.text: Style
children.text2: Style to apply to this element.

children.name: addStyle(Style style)
children.text: Applies a predefined style to paragraph text.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("A4"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); // Create a style var paraStyle = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Style(); paraStyle.setFontSize(48); paraStyle.setBold(); // my paragraph var para = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Document Title"); para.setFixedPosition(204,400,240); para.setTextAlignment("text-center"); para.addStyle(paraStyle); document.addParagraph(para); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "fileName.pdf");
children.text2: The following shows how to set a fixed position on a page. For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: left
children.text: Number
children.text2: Indentation from the left side of the PDF page in points.

children.name: bottom
children.text: Number
children.text2: Position from the bottom of the PDF page in points.

children.name: width
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Width of the paragraph element in points. This value determines the length at
                which the line breaks.

children.name: setFixedPosition(Number left, Number bottom, Number width)
children.text: Sets a paragraph element to a fixed position on the page.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var margins = 48.0; var myPara = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text with all margins set to the same value."); myPara.setMargin(margins); document.addParagraph(myPara); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docName.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the all margins of the paragraph to 48 points.

children.name: margin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Value of the top, right, bottom, and left margins in points.

children.name: setMargin(Number margin)
children.text: Sets each paragraph margin.
children.text2: To set all four margins with one or more unique values, use setMargins().

children.name: margin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Height of the bottom margin in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var marginVal = 1.0; var paraMarginBottom = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text with bottom margin set."); paraMarginBottom.setMarginBottom(marginVal); document.addParagraph(paraMarginBottom); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docName.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the bottom margin of a paragraph to one point.

children.name: setMarginBottom(Number margin)
children.text: Sets the bottom margin of a paragraph.

children.name: leftMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the left margin in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var marginVal = 1.0; var paraMarginLeft = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text with left margin set."); paraMarginLeft.setMarginLeft(marginVal); document.addParagraph(paraMarginLeft); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docName.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the left margin of a paragraph to one point.

children.name: setMarginLeft(Number margin)
children.text: Sets the left margin of a paragraph.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var marginVal = 1.0; var paraMarginRight = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text with right margin set."); paraMarginRight.setMarginRight(marginVal); document.addParagraph(paraMarginRight); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docName.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the right margin of a paragraph to one point.

children.name: margin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the right margin in points.

children.name: setMarginRight(Number margin)
children.text: Sets the right margin of a paragraph.

children.name: Example
children.text: var para = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text."); var topMargin = 1.0; var rightMargin = 1.0; var bottomMargin = 1.0; var leftMargin = 1.5; para.setMargins(marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom, marginLeft);
children.text2: The following shows how to set paragraph margins.For a document usage example, see Document API.

children.name: topMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Height of the top margin in points.

children.name: rightMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the right margin in points.

children.name: bottomMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Height of the bottom margin in points.

children.name: leftMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Width of the left margin in points.

children.name: setMargins(Number marginTop, Number marginRight, Number marginBottom, Number marginLeft)
children.text: Sets a size for each paragraph margin.
children.text2: To set each margin to the same value, use setMargin().

children.name: margin
children.text: Number
children.text2: Height of the top margin in points.

children.name: Example
children.text: var pageSize = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfPage("LETTER"); var document = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Document.createDocument(pageSize); var marginVal = 1.0; var paraMarginTop = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("Paragraph text with top margin set."); paraMarginTop.setMarginTop(marginVal); document.addParagraph(paraMarginTop); // save pdf as attachment to target record in the Incident table document.saveAsAttachment("incident", "<record_sys_id>", "docName.pdf");
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the top margin of a paragraph to one point.

children.name: setMarginTop(Number margin)
children.text: Sets the top margin of a paragraph.

children.name: Example
children.text: var paragraph = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Paragraph("This paragraph text is centered."); var alignment = "text-center"; paragraph.setTextAlignment(alignment);
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the paragraph text to left alignment.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Text alignment position.
Valid values:
  • text-center: Aligns text to the center.
  • text-justified: Modifies the space between characters to completely fill text between the left and right sides. The final line is left-aligned.
  • text-justified-all: Justifies text alignment including the final line.
  • text-left: Align text to the left.
  • text-right: Align text to the right.

children.name: setTextAlignment(String alignment)
children.text: Sets the text alignment of this paragraph.

name: Paragraph
text: Creates a Paragraph object representing a block of text in a PDF.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

This API is a component used with the Document API to generate a PDF.

children.name: Example
children.text: var v = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PDFGenerationAPI;
children.text2: The following shows how to create a PDFGenerationAPI object.

children.name: PDFGenerationAPI()
children.text: Instantiates a new PDFGenerationAPI object.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Object containing sys_id of the PDF attachment if conversion is successful, error message otherwise.
{
  "attachment_id": "String",
  "message": "String",
  "request_id": "String",
  "status": "String"
}

children.name: Output
children.text: {"attachment_id":"<sys_id>","message":"Conversion is successful.","request_id":"<change_sys_id>","status":"success"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var v = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PDFGenerationAPI; // (Option) get HTML from the description field of an incident record var gr = new GlideRecord("incident"); var html; if (gr.get("<tableSysId>")) { html = gr.description.toString(); } var result = v.convertToPDF(html, "incident", "<target_sys_id>", "myPDF"); gs.info(JSON.stringify(result));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to convert HTML to a PDF and attach it to a record in the
        Incident [incident] table.

children.name: html
children.text: String
children.text2: HTML to convert to a PDF document.

children.name: <Object>.​attachment_id
children.text:
If HTML conversion is successful, sys_id of the converted and attached PDF. The file is listed in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

Data type: String

children.name: targetTable
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the table on which to attach the converted PDF.

children.name: convertToPDF(String html, String targetTable, String targetTableSysId, String pdfName, String fontFamilySysId, Object documentConfiguration)
children.text: Converts an HTML string to a PDF document.
children.text2: To generate a PDF with header and footer information, such as page numbers, use convertToPDFWithHeaderFooter().

children.name: html
children.text: String
children.text2: HTML to convert to a PDF document.

children.name: Output
children.text: {"attachment_id":"<sys_id>","message":"Conversion is successful.","request_id":"<change_sys_id>","status":"success"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var v = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PDFGenerationAPI; // (Option) get HTML from the description field of an incident record var gr = new GlideRecord("incident"); var html; if (gr.get("<tableSysId>")) { html = gr.description.toString(); } var hfInfo = new Object(); hfInfo["HeaderImageAttachmentId"] = "<hdrImgAttSysId>"; hfInfo["HeaderImageAlignment"] = "left"; hfInfo["FooterImageAttachmentId"] = "<ftrImgAttSysId>"; hfInfo["FooterImageAlignment"] = "TOP_CENTER"; hfInfo["FooterText"] = "Sample Footer Message"; hfInfo["PageSize"] = "A4"; hfInfo["GeneratePageNumber"] = "false"; hfInfo["TopOrBottomMargin"] = "36"; hfInfo["LeftOrRightMargin"] = "24"; var result = v.convertToPDFWithHeaderFooter(html, "incident", "<targetTbl_sys_id>", "myPDF", hfInfo); gs.info(JSON.stringify(result));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to convert HTML to a PDF named "myPDF" and add the PDF as
        an attachment to a record in the Incident [incident] table. The PDF contains header and
        footer provided via attachment.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Object containing sys_id of the PDF attachment if conversion is successful, error message otherwise.
{
  "attachment_id": "String",
  "message": "String",
  "request_id": "String",
  "status": "String"
}

children.name: targetTable
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the table on which to attach the converted PDF.

children.name: <Object>.​attachment_id
children.text:
If HTML conversion is successful, sys_id of the converted and attached PDF. The file is listed in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.​message
children.text:
Message confirming success or error.
Possible values:
  • Conversion failed. – No PDF created. Make sure the values provided are accurate.
  • Conversion is successful. – The HTML successfully converted to PDF.
  • Footer Image alignment and text alignment cannot be in the same region with same alignment: <footerImageAlignment value> – Make sure that headerFooterInfo.​FooterImageAlignment and headerFooterInfo.​FooterTextAlignment values are not in the same area.
  • Exception while reading Source document contents. PDF header not found. – Input attachment provided is not a valid PDF. Provide the correct attachment sys_id.
  • Given target record [<tableName> - <targetTableSysId>] does not exist. – Target table sys_id is not in the table provided. Make sure you include the correct table name for the record.
  • Invalid footer image alignment: <invalid_option> is provided. – Provide a valid option in the headerFooterInfo.​FooterImageAlignment property.
  • Invalid footer text alignment: " + <invalid_option> + " is provided. – Provide a valid option in the headerFooterInfo.​footerTextAlignment property.
  • No Form associated with pdf to fill. attachmentSysId: <sys_id>
  • No editable fields exist with specified names. Please check and try again. field names: <field names>
  • Request cannot proceed as the attachment with sys_id [{0}] did not pass security scan – The PDF did not pass the antivirus scan.
  • Request cannot proceed as the attachment with sys_id [{0}] is pending security scan – The PDF requires an antivirus scan.
  • Request completed successfully – Operation is successful.
  • Unable to get the footer image. sysId: + <value provided> – Make sure the sys_id provided for headerFooterInfo.​footerImageId is accurate.
  • Unable to get the header image. sysId: + <value provided> – Make sure the sys_id provided for headerFooterInfo.​headerImageId is accurate.
  • Undefined – Sys_id provided does not exist or is not a PDF attachment.

Data type: String

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​FooterImageAlignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sets the image position in the footer.
Valid values:
  • BOTTOM_CENTER: Position the image in the bottom center of the footer.
  • BOTTOM_LEFT: Position the image in the bottom left area of the
  • BOTTOM_RIGHT: Position the image in the bottom right area of the footer.
  • TOP_CENTER: Position the image in the top center of the footer.
  • TOP_LEFT: Position the image in the top left area of the footer.
  • TOP_RIGHT: Position the image in the top right area of the footer.

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​FooterImageAttachmentId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the footer image in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table. To determine if the file type is supported in your instance, Navigate to System Properties > Security and check if it's listed in List of file extensions (comma-separated) that can be attached field.

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​FooterImageHeight
children.text: String
children.text2:
Height of footer image.

Default: 50 points

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​FooterText
children.text: String
children.text2: Footer text to place at the bottom of each PDF page.

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​FooterTextAlignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sets the text position in the footer. Make sure this value does not match or conflict with the area provided in headerFooterInfo.FooterImageAlignment.
Valid values:
  • BOTTOM_CENTER: Position the text in the bottom center of the footer.
  • BOTTOM_LEFT: Position the text in the bottom left area of the
  • BOTTOM_RIGHT: Position the text in the bottom right area of the footer.
  • TOP_CENTER: Position the text in the top center of the footer.
  • TOP_LEFT: Position the text in the top left area of the footer.
  • TOP_RIGHT: Position the text in the top right area of the footer.

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​GeneratePageNumber
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to generate a PDF page number.
Valid values:
  • true: Generate page numbers.
  • false: Do not generate page numbers.

Default: true

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​HeaderImageAlignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sets the image position in the header.
Valid values:
  • center: Position the image in the center of the header.
  • left: Position the image on the left side of the header.
  • right: Position the image on the right side of the header.

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​HeaderImageAttachmentId

children.text2:

Default: 50 points

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​LeftOrRightMargin
children.text: String
children.text2:
Size of the left and right margins. If positioned in the left or right side of the page, header/footer details are placed within in this area.

Default: 36 points

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​PageOrientation
children.text: String
children.text2:
Page orientation.
Valid values:

  • LANDSCAPE

Default: Portrait

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​PageSize
children.text: String
children.text2:
Document page size.
Valid values:
  • A4 – 595 × 842 points
  • LETTER – 612 × 792 points
  • LEDGER – 792 x 1224 points

children.name: headerFooterInfo.​TopOrBottomMargin
children.text: String
children.text2:
Size of the top and bottom margins. Header and footer details are placed within in this area.

Default: 72 points

children.name: fillDocumentFields(Object fieldsMap, String sysId, String tableName, String tableSysId, String pdfName)
children.text: Fills fields in an editable PDF and attaches it to the provided record.
children.text2:
Use the following methods to determine if the PDF is fillable and get field information:

  • isDocumentFillable()
  • getDocumentFields()
  • getDocumentFieldsType()

PDFGenerationAPI provides additional fill methods with different options:

  • fillDocumentFieldsAndFlatten() – Fills fields in an editable PDF, flattens the data fields, and attaches it to the provided record.
  • fillFieldsAndMergeSignature() – Fills fields in an editable PDF, adds signature image, flattens the data fields, and attaches it to the provided record.
  • getFilledDocumentWithSignatureAsBase64() – Fills fields in an editable PDF, creates an image, and converts it to a Base64-encoded PDF.

children.name: Output
children.text: "attachment_id":"<sys_id>","message":"Request completed successfully.","status":"success"

children.name: Example
children.text: var fieldMap = new Object(); fieldMap["Last Name First Name Middle Initial"] = "Tuter Abel E."; fieldMap["Date of Birth"] = "08101952"; fieldMap["US SSN"] = "111-22-9999"; fieldMap["Address"] = "PO Box 344"; fieldMap["City"] = "Jerome"; fieldMap["State"] = "AZ"; fieldMap["Zip"] = "86331"; var flatten = new Object(); flatten["FlattenType"] = "partially_flatten"; var v = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PDFGenerationAPI; var result = v.fillDocumentFieldsAndFlatten(fieldMap, "<attachmentSysId>", "<tableName>", "<tableSysId>", "pdfName", flatten); gs.info(JSON.stringify(result));

children.name: flatten
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional. Flattening fields enable locking the fields so that other users cannot change the information. Specify the key as "FlattenType" and provide a flattening option as a string.
Valid values:
  • donot_flatten - Do not flatten any fields.
  • partially_flatten - Flatten only the fields which are modified.
  • fully_flatten - Flattens all the fields.

Default: fully_flatten

{
  "FlattenType": "String" 
}

children.name: getFilledDocumentWithSignatureAsBase64(Object fieldsMap, String sysId, PdfMergeSignRequestor requestor, Object flatten)
children.text: Fills fields in an editable PDF, creates an image, and converts it to a Base64-encoded PDF.
children.text2:
Base64 encoding enables you to output a PDF as a string within a text document, such as HTML or JSON, without damaging the binary character syntax.

Use the following methods to determine if the PDF is fillable and get field information:

  • isDocumentFillable()
  • getDocumentFields()
  • getDocumentFieldsType()

PDFGenerationAPI provides additional fill methods with different options:

  • fillDocumentFields() – Fills fields in an editable PDF and attaches it to the provided record.
  • fillDocumentFieldsAndFlatten() – Fills fields in an editable PDF, flattens the data fields, and attaches it to the provided record.
  • fillFieldsAndMergeSignature() – Fills fields in an editable PDF, adds signature image, flattens the data fields, and attaches it to the provided record.

name: PDFGenerationAPI API
text: Provides support for PDF conversion and handling PDF fields.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

These methods can also be used for documents created by non-catalog items. The methods in this class enable the following tasks:
  • Dynamically generate a PDF from an HTML string and attach it to a record
  • Fill fields in a PDF
  • Sign a PDF
  • Unflattened, flattened, or partially flattened
  • Retrieving PDF field data
Related APIs:
  • PdfMergeSignRequestor
  • SVGToPDFConversionAPI

children.name: Example
children.text: var v = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfMergeSignRequestor;
children.text2: The following s shows how to create a PdfMergeSignRequestor object.

children.name: PdfMergeSignRequestor()
children.text: Instantiates a new PdfMergeSignRequestor object.

children.name: pageNumber
children.text: Number
children.text2: Number of the page on which to insert the signature.

children.name: Example
children.text: var requestor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfMergeSignRequestor; // For the purpose of this example, set signature sizes and page number for signature placement var page = 2; var leftMargin = 48; var topMargin = 60; var signatureWidth = 96; var signatureHeight = 36; requestor.addSignatureMapping(page, leftMargin, topMargin, signatureWidth, signatureHeight, "<signatureSysId>");
children.text2: The following shows how to add the signature mapping. For a complete example, see processRequest().

children.name: leftMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Value in points representing the left margin area of the page at which to
                insert the signature.

children.name: topMargin
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Value in points representing the top margin area of the page at which to insert
                the signature image.

children.name: boxWidth
children.text: Number
children.text2: Value in points representing width of the box to contain the signature.

children.name: boxHeight
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Value in points representing height of the box to contain the signature
                image.

children.name: sysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the signature image in the Attachments [sys_attachment]
                table.

children.name: addSignatureMapping(Number pageNumber, Number leftMargin, Number topMargin, Number boxWidth, Number boxHeight, String sysId)
children.text: Assigns signature size and position requirements in the PDF.

children.name: Example
children.text: var requestor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfMergeSignRequestor; requestor.createRequest("<sys_id>", "tableName", "<tableSysId>", "pdfFileName");
children.text2: The following shows how to create a signature request. For a complete example, see processRequest().

children.name: targetSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a PDF in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table. Use this value as the target PDF on which to add a signature.

children.name: targetTable
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the table containing the record to which the PDF
        is attached. You can find this value in the same row as the attachment listed in the
        Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: tableSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the record to which the PDF is attached. You can
                find this value in the same row as the attachment listed in the Attachments
                [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: targetFileName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the target PDF without extension.

children.name: createRequest(String targetSysId, String targetTable, String tableSysId, String targetFileName)
children.text: Creates a signature request with source and target inputs.

children.name: Example
children.text: var requestor = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.PdfMergeSignRequestor; requestor.createRequest("<sys_id>", "tableName", "<tableSysId>", pdfFileName); // For the purpose of this example, set signature sizes and page number for signature placement var page = 6; var leftMargin = 40; var topMargin = 50; var signatureWidth = 188; var signatureHeight = 44; requestor.addSignatureMapping(page, leftMargin, topMargin, signatureWidth, signatureHeight, "<signatureSysId>"); var result = requestor.processRequest(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(result));
children.text2: The following  shows how to process the signature request.

children.name: Object
<Object>.attachment_id
children.text:
If the request is successful, sys_id of the signed and attached PDF. The file is listed in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.message
children.text:
Possible values:
  • Request cannot proceed as the attachment with sys_id [{0}] did not pass security scan – The PDF did not pass the antivirus scan.
  • No signature mapping specified. Cannot process this request – Provide signature mapping using the addSignatureMapping() method.
  • Request completed successfully.
  • Request failure. Exceptions while trying to add signatures to document. Please check again.
  • This request cannot be completed as the requested page does not exist. page No: <page number>

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.status
children.text:
Status indicating whether the operation is successful.
Possible values:
  • success - Operation was successful.
  • failure – Operation was not successful. The message provides details.

Data type: String

children.name: processRequest()
children.text: Processes requests and adds the signatures.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Text alignment position.
Valid values:
  • text-center: Aligns text to the center.
  • text-justified: Modifies the space between characters to completely fill text between the left and right sides. The final line is left-aligned.
  • text-justified-all: Justifies text alignment including the final line.
  • text-left: Align text to the left.
  • text-right: Align text to the right.

children.name: Example
children.text: var style = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Style(); String alignment = "text-center"; style.setTextAlignment(alignment);
children.text2: The following  shows how to set the element text to center alignment.

children.name: alignment
children.text: String
children.text2:
Vertical alignment setting.
Valid values:

  • mid: Aligns contents to the center.
  • top: Aligns contents to the top.

children.name: Example
children.text: var style = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.Style(); var alignment = "Mid"; style.setVerticalAlignment(alignment);

children.name: setVerticalAlignment(String alignment)
children.text: Sets the vertical alignment for this element.

name: Style
text: Creates a style for defining properties such font size, border, and alignment. You can apply the same style to multiple objects simultaneously.
text2:
This API is part of the ServiceNow PDF Generation Utilities plugin (com.snc.apppdfgenerator) and is provided within the sn_pdfgeneratorutils namespace. The plugin is activated by default.

This API is a component used with the Document API to generate a PDF.

You can apply custom styles to the following API elements:
  • Cell
  • Paragraph
  • Table

children.name: Example
children.text: var v = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.SVGToPDFConversionAPI();
children.text2: The following s shows how to create a SVGToPDFConversionAPI object.

children.name: SVGToPDFConversionAPI()
children.text: Instantiates a new SVGToPDFConversionAPI object.

children.name: Object
Output
children.text: {"attachment_id":"<sys_id>","message":"Adding SVG to PDF and creating new PDF is successful.","status":"success"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var gr = new GlideRecord("incident"); var svg; if (gr.get("<tableSysId>")) { svg = gr.description.toString(); } var result = new sn_pdfgeneratorutils.SVGToPDFConversionAPI().addSVGToPDF(svg, "<inputPdfSysId>", "incident", "<tableSysId>", "AddSVGToPDF", 5, 30, 30, 300, 100); gs.info(JSON.stringify(result));
children.text2:
The following  shows how get SVG from the description field of an incident record
        and add it to page 5 of a PDF attachment. The new PDF with SVG is located in the Attachments
        [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: svg
children.text: String
children.text2: SVG to convert to a PDF document.

children.name: <Object>.​attachment_id
children.text:
If SVG conversion is successful, sys_id of the attached PDF. The file is listed in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

Data type: String

children.name: inputPdfSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the target PDF in which to create a copy of with an SVG. The target
                PDF is in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: targetTable
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the table containing the record to which the PDF
        is attached. You can find this value in the same row as the attachment listed in the
        Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: <Object>.message
children.text:
Message confirming success or error.
Possible values:
  • Adding SVG content to PDF failed.
  • Adding SVG to PDF and creating new PDF is successful.
  • Given target record [<tableName> - <targetTableSysId>] does not exist. – Target table sys_id is not in the table provided. Make sure you include the correct table name for the record.
  • Input PDF attachment sys id to add the SVG content is null
  • Input SVG content is empty or null
  • PdfReader is not opened with owner password
  • The target table name to attach the modified PDF : <targetTable> is empty or null
  • The target table name to attach the modified PDF : <targetTable> is not valid

Data type: String

children.name: targetTableSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the record to which the PDF is attached. You can
                find this value in the same row as the attachment listed in the Attachments
                [sys_attachment] table.

children.name: <Object>.status
children.text:
Status indicating whether the operation is successful.
Possible values:
  • success - Operation was successful.
  • failure – Operation was not successful. The message provides details.

Data type: String

children.name: targetTable
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the table on which to attach the converted PDF.

children.name: targetTableSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of the record on which to attach the converted PDF.

children.name: pdfName
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name to give the PDF.

Default: Sys_id of the PDF in the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

children.text: Number
children.text2: Page number in the attached PDF on which to place the SVG.

children.text: Number
children.text2: Horizontal position of the SVG in the page. Value is in points.

children.name: y
children.text: Number
children.text2: Vertical position of the SVG in the page. Value is in points.

children.name: svgImgHeight
